entry.tran: （尤指敌军之间的）武力冲突，流血事件，杀戮
entry.def: Blood-letting is violence or killing between groups of people, especially between rival armies.

example.ex: Once again there's been ferocious blood-letting in the township.
example.tran: 镇区再次发生了残忍的流血事件。

entry.def: Journalists sometimes refer to a bitter quarrel between two groups of people from  within the same organization as blood-letting.

example.ex: Hopefully a satisfactory solution can be reached without much blood letting.
example.tran: 有望在不引起严重内讧的情况下达成一个满意的解决方案。

means.word_mean: 1. formerly used as a treatment to reduce excess blood (one of the four humors of medieval medicine)
